usefulItems: parchment paper, loaf pan (9 in. x 5 in.), skewer, wire rack, oven
title: Apple Fritter Bread

ingredients.content: 10 oz Granny Smith apples (approx. 3), peeled, diced (¼ in.)
4 oz unsalted butter, room temperature, diced (½ in.)

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease a loaf pan (9 in. x 5 in.), line bottom with a piece of parchment and set aside.
Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid and weigh in apples, brown sugar, cinnamon, ginger and nutmeg. Stir with spatula to combine and set aside.
Place sugar and butter into mixing bowl and mix <b>1 min/speed 3<b>.
Add applesauce, milk, eggs and vanilla and mix <b>10 sec/speed 3<b>.
Add flour, baking powder and salt and mix <b>10 sec/speed 3.5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix a further <b>10 sec/speed 3.5<b>.
Add reserved apples (reserving 1 cup for topping) to batter, stir through with spatula to combine. Transfer to prepared pan and top with remaining reserved apples.
Bake for 70-75 minutes (350°F) until a skewer inserted in the center comes out clean. Let cool in pan for 10 minutes before transferring to a wire rack. Let cool completely before glazing.

hintsAndTricks: For a thinner glaze, reduce the confectioner's sugar to 1 oz.
